sentences: Minemata ei või jätta, see oleks argus. Argust ei saa talle ette heita, arguses ei saa teda süüdistada.
context: The Estonian verb 'süüdistada' means to accuse someone of wrongdoing, typically in a formal or legal context. It is used when formally charging someone with a crime or fault. The word can be conjugated into different forms: süüdistan (I accuse), süüdistad (you accuse), süüdistab (he/she/it accuses), süüdistame (we accuse), süüdistate (you plural/formal accuse), and süüdistavad (they accuse).
